alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 1:54PM EST until January 28 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Between 17 and 18 feet, Flood stage is reached. The water level reaches the top of the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and rightbank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge. Minor flooding of woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 17.7 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EST Friday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.6 feet on 02/18/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
